trans-unit.source: Opens the access token associated with a thread

seg-source.mrk: Opens the access token associated with a thread

target.mrk: Opens the access token associated with a thread

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Access mask that specifies the requested types of access to the access token.

seg-source.mrk: Access mask that specifies the requested types of access to the access token.

target.mrk: Access mask that specifies the requested types of access to the access token.

trans-unit.source: These requested access types are reconciled against the token's discretionary access control list (DACL) to determine which accesses are granted or denied.

seg-source.mrk: These requested access types are reconciled against the token's discretionary access control list (DACL) to determine which accesses are granted or denied.

target.mrk: These requested access types are reconciled against the token's discretionary access control list (DACL) to determine which accesses are granted or denied.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Handle to the thread whose access token is opened

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Handle to the thread whose access token is opened

target.mrk: [optional]
Handle to the thread whose access token is opened

trans-unit.source: [optional] Indicates whether the access check is to be made against the security context of the thread calling the OpenThreadToken function or against the security context of the process for the calling thread.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Indicates whether the access check is to be made against the security context of the thread calling the OpenThreadToken function or against the security context of the process for the calling thread.

target.mrk: [optional]
Indicates whether the access check is to be made against the security context of the thread calling the OpenThreadToken function or against the security context of the process for the calling thread.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is False, the access check is performed using the security context for the calling thread.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is False, the access check is performed using the security context for the calling thread.

target.mrk: If this parameter is False, the access check is performed using the security context for the calling thread.

trans-unit.source: If the thread is impersonating a client, this security context can be that of a client process.

seg-source.mrk: If the thread is impersonating a client, this security context can be that of a client process.

target.mrk: If the thread is impersonating a client, this security context can be that of a client process.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is True, the access check is made using the security context of the process for the calling thread.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is True, the access check is made using the security context of the process for the calling thread.

target.mrk: If this parameter is True, the access check is made using the security context of the process for the calling thread.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: a handle to the newly opened access token.

seg-source.mrk: a handle to the newly opened access token.

target.mrk: a handle to the newly opened access token.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: OpenThreadToken will fail if not impersonating.

seg-source.mrk: OpenThreadToken will fail if not impersonating.

target.mrk: OpenThreadToken will fail if not impersonating.
